main_definition: Of is a preposition used to indicate belonging, origin, composition, or relationship between two things.

meanings_and_examples.example: The keys of the car are on the table.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to a specific group, category, or class
meanings_and_examples.example: She is studying French literature of the 19th century.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Describing what something consists of or includes
meanings_and_examples.example: A glass of cold water and some fruit are part of a healthy meal.
I am from the United States, born in New York City.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Showing connection between things as parts of a whole
meanings_and_examples.example: The petals of the rose are vibrant and beautiful.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Denoting the time or duration during which something occurs
meanings_and_examples.example: I will be at work from 9 am to 5 pm today.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing that one thing is related to another by a standard, rule, or principle
meanings_and_examples.example: The principles of mathematics are universal and applicable everywhere.
